result.execSummary:
The defendant Alonzo Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Alonzo Perez was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alonzo Perez is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Alonzo Perez was found guilty of Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Alonzo Perez was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Alonzo Perez was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
08-30-2017/ Judge Michael Hanrahan 
Court ordered that the JOC shall be amended by vacating court costs on all counts and DNA surcharges on counts two and  four.   The defendant's motion to vacate the domestic abuse surcharge is denied.                  

Due to financial hardship, Court waived non-mandatory surcharges of this case, except the domestic abuse surcharge. Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence with credit for 162 days time served

Court ordered that the JOC shall be amended by vacating court costs on all counts and DNA surcharges on counts   two and four. Defendat's motion to vacate the domestic abuse surcharge is denied.

Defendant Alonzo Perez in court with attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo.  Defendant Alonzo Perez in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 162 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 4:  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served. 

COURT STAYED COUNTS 2 AND 4 and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 12/05/14.
-Taking a parenting of teens class.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Complete a gambling addiction class.
-No gambling or being at any place where gambling takes place.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-Complete 50 hours of community service at Soujourner Truth House or another woman's improvement group.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Due to financial hardship, Court waived non-mandatory costs and surcharges of this case, except the Domestic Abuse surcharge.  Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.

At the request of the defense, Court modified the no contact order to remove J.P. (DOB:  04/12/2003).

Defendant Alonzo Perez in court with attorney Kristian K Lindo.  Defendant Alonzo Perez in custody.  Michael C Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
On the same day, at the hour of 11:54 am, the jury returned and by the foreperson brought in a verdict of GUILTY AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3 (COUNTS 1 AND 4 OF THE AMENDED INFORMATION) and NOT GUILTY AS TO COUNT 2 (COUNT 3 OF THE AMENDED INFORMATION), which were read in open court.
The Court polled the Jury and each juror acknowledged the correctness of the verdicts.  Jury verdicts received and filed.  Jury discharged.
The Court denied the defense motion for judgment notwithstanding the verdict as to COUNTS 1 AND 3 (COUNTS 1 AND 4 OF THE AMENDED INFORMATION) and granted their motion for judgment of acquittal as to COUNT 2 (COUNT 3 OF THE AMENDED INFORMATION).
The Court granted the State's motion for judgments on the verdict as to COUNTS 1 AND 3 (COUNTS 1 AND 4 OF THE AMENDED INFORMATION) and ordered that judgments of conviction be entered on the record.  Defense may be filing a motion pertaining to an exhibit given to the jury during deliberations.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  At request of the parties, Court ordered PSI report.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Alonzo Perez in court with attorney Kristian K Lindo.  Defendant Alonzo Perez in custody.  Michael Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Jury in box at 8:43 am.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 9:30 am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies M. Tinsley and G. Bird who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Defendant Alonzo Perez in court with attorney Kristian K Lindo.  Defendant Alonzo Perez in custody.  Michael C Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Out of the presence of the jury, sidebars put on the record.  Jury in the box at 1:47 pm.  Trial continued.  Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee Police Sargeant Jesus Ortiz. Exhibit #'s 1,2,3 and 4 received.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee County Witness Protection Unit Analyst Amy Lagueux.  Exhibit #'s 5 and 6 received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court. Defendant examined by the Court as to his right to testify or not to testify and found defendant freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to testify.  Instructions reviewed by the parties. Jury in the box.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box.  Court instructed jury.

Jury in the box at 10:28 am and sworn.   Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Rebecca N. and City of Milwaukee Police Officer David Miller. Exhibit  * received.

Defendant Alonzo Perez in court with attorney Kristian K Lindo.  Defendant Alonzo Perez in custody.  Michael C Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  3:23 pm.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled.  Jury list received and filed.  Jury excused for the evening at 4:50 pm.  Jury trial continued to 7/01/14 at 9:00 am.
